Sign up to gain a broad overview of the disciplines that explain the human world.

courseDescription:
This course provides a broad overview of social sciences, the academic disciplines that study society and the human world (also called the ‘humanities’). We explain what defines ‘social sciences’ and explore their history and evolution. After outlining the relevant disciplines, we discuss the role of scientific theory and the scientific method in research conducted into social subjects and philosophy.

We discuss the branches of social science in detail, from sociology, economics and history to anthropology, mass communication and more. We identify the role played by each of these subjects in our society and describe their historical evolution. We also examine the interaction between these disciplines as the social sciences seek to explain the complexities of human behaviour. Research is a major part of academic pursuit and we lay out the basics of research methodology to help you begin on your path towards effective scholarship.

The course establishes the important role of the social sciences in modern society as they form a crucial part of modern science and philosophy. We analyse this relationship in depth as the social sciences cover vast subject areas and is its own profession. Whether you want to pursue this career path or simply want to satisfy your personal curiosity of the human world, this course provides a solid foundation on which to build your expertise. Sign up for this social science course to gain a broad perspective on the many interacting academic disciplines that explain the complexities of human behaviour.
